required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate the Utility of 18FDG-PET as a Tool to Quantify Atherosclerotic Plaque (MK-0000-081 AM3)(COMPLETED)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel Group Study to Evaluate the Effects of High Dose Statin Therapy on 18Fluorine Fluorodeoxyglucose (18FDG) Uptake in Arteries of Patients With Atherosclerotic Vascular Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the utility of 18Fluorine Fluorodeoxyglucose Positron Emission Tomography (18FDG-PET) as a tool to quantify atherosclerotic plaque.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Reduction From Baseline in TBRmeanmax of the Qualifying Segment
primary_outcome.description: Vascular plaque inflammation was measured by 18FDG-PET imaging. Uptake of FDG by the carotid and thoracic aorta is expressed as the target, vessel wall to background, lumen ratio (TBR). TBRmax of an axial cross section of a vessel (a slice) is defined as the maximum TBR within a slice and TBRmeanmax is the mean of TBRmax for all slices in the qualifying segment. The qualifying segment is the left or right carotid or thoracic aorta with the greatest FDG uptake value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Reduction From Baseline in TBRmeanmax of the Qualifying Segment in Statin-naive Participants
secondary_outcome.description: Vascular plaque inflammation was measured by 18FDG-PET imaging. Uptake of FDG by the carotid and thoracic aorta is expressed as the target, vessel wall to background, lumen ratio (TBR). TBRmax of an axial cross section of a vessel (a slice) is defined as the maximum TBR within a slice and TBRmeanmax is the mean of TBRmax for all slices in the qualifying segment. The qualifying segment is the left or right carotid or thoracic aorta with the greatest FDG uptake value at Baseline.

intervention.description: Participants will be asked to self-administer one atorvastatin 10 mg or 80 mg tablet at approximately the same time each day.
Participants will be asked to self-administer one tablet of placebo to atorvastatin 10 mg or 80 mg at approximately the same time each day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or Female ages 30 to 80
- Participant is on a low dose statin for at least 6 weeks prior to screening or is statin-naive at screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant has human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), Hepatitis B or C
- Participant uses illegal drugs
- Participant has Type I diabetes
- Participant has a history of claustrophobia

group.title: 10 mg Atorvastatin
group.description: Participants self-administered one 10 mg atorvastatin tablet and one 80 mg atorvastatin matching placebo tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: 80 mg Atorvastatin
group.description: Participants self-administered one 80 mg atorvastatin tablet and one 10 mg atorvastatin matching placebo tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: 10 mg Atorvastatin
group.description: Participants self-administered one 10 mg atorvastatin tablet and one 80 mg atorvastatin matching placebo tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: 80 mg Atorvastatin
group.description: Participants self-administered one 80 mg atorvastatin tablet and one 10 mg atorvastatin matching placebo tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks.

outcome.title: Percent Reduction From Baseline in TBRmeanmax of the Qualifying Segment
outcome.description: Vascular plaque inflammation was measured by 18FDG-PET imaging. Uptake of FDG by the carotid and thoracic aorta is expressed as the target, vessel wall to background, lumen ratio (TBR). TBRmax of an axial cross section of a vessel (a slice) is defined as the maximum TBR within a slice and TBRmeanmax is the mean of TBRmax for all slices in the qualifying segment. The qualifying segment is the left or right carotid or thoracic aorta with the greatest FDG uptake value at Baseline.
outcome.population: The analysis population includes all participants who completed the study and had complete image sets with usable data.

group.title: 10 mg Atorvastatin
group.description: Participants self-administered one 10 mg atorvastatin tablet and one matching 80 mg atorvastatin placebo tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: 80 mg Atorvastatin
group.description: Participants self-administered one 80 mg atorvastatin tablet and one matching 10 mg atorvastatin placebo tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks.

outcome.description: Vascular plaque inflammation was measured by 18FDG-PET imaging. TBRmax of an axial cross section of a vessel (a slice) is defined as the maximum TBR within a slice and TBRmeanmax is the mean of TBRmax for all slices in the qualifying segment. outcome.population: The analysis population includes all statin-naive participants who completed the study and had complete image sets.

group.title: Statin-Naive Participants
group.description: Participants self-administered one 10 mg or 80 mg atorvastatin tablet and one matching 80 mg or 10 mg atorvastatin placebo tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks.

Uptake of FDG by the carotid and thoracic aorta is expressed as the target, vessel wall to background, lumen ratio (TBR). TBRmax of an axial cross section of a vessel (a slice) is defined as the maximum TBR within a slice and TBRmeanmax is the mean of TBRmax for all slices in the qualifying segment. group.title: 10 mg Atorvastatin
group.description: Participants self-administered one 10 mg atorvastatin tablet and one 80 mg atorvastatin matching placebo tablet orally once daily for 12 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission. Sponsor review can be expedited to meet publication guidelines.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
